column6: TA5.7;Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste;-1;The reduction of GHG emissions can lead to increased energy efficiency
column7: which may result in reduced waste generation in municipal areas
column8: but it can also lead to increased costs for waste management
column9: potentially constraining waste reduction efforts. This can create a trade-off between GHG reduction and waste reduction goals.;

column6: TA5.7;Circularity/Recycling;+2;GHG reduction targets can reinforce circularity and recycling efforts by promoting the use of renewable energy sources
column9: which can lead to a more circular economy. This can aid in the achievement of circularity and recycling targets.;

column1: GHG Reduction - Buildings;TA1.15;Waste Reduction - Municipal Waste;-1;The reduction of GHG emissions in buildings can lead to increased use of materials and resources
column2: potentially resulting in more waste generation
column3: which can constrain municipal waste reduction efforts. This can create a trade-off between building-related GHG reduction and municipal waste reduction goals.;

column1: GHG Reduction - Transports;TA1.10;Circularity/Recycling - Vehicle Circularity;+1;The reduction of GHG emissions in the transport sector can enable the development of more circular and sustainable vehicle production and end-of-life management practices
column2: creating conditions that further vehicle circularity targets. This can lead to increased recycling and reuse of vehicle materials
column3: reducing waste and promoting a more circular economy.;

column1: GHG Removal;TA7.8;Critical Raw Materials - Extraction & Import;-2;The removal of GHG emissions can counteract the extraction and import of critical raw materials
column2: as some of these materials may be used in GHG removal technologies
column3: potentially leading to conflicts between GHG removal and critical raw material extraction goals. This can create a trade-off between these two targets.;
TA4.15;Net-Zero Technology - Manufacturing;+3;Climate resilience targets are inextricably linked to the development and manufacturing of net-zero technologies
column4: as these technologies are necessary for reducing GHG emissions and achieving climate resilience. The development of net-zero technologies can aid in the achievement of climate resilience targets

column6: TA5.7;Waste Reduction - Food Waste;+1;The reduction of GHG emissions can enable the reduction of food waste by promoting more efficient food production
column9: creating conditions that further food waste reduction targets. This can lead to reduced GHG emissions from food waste and promote a more circular food system.;

column1: GHG Reduction - Buildings;TA1.15;Circularity/Recycling - Municipal Waste;+2;The reduction of GHG emissions in buildings can reinforce circularity and recycling efforts in municipal waste management by promoting the use of recycled materials
column3: and increasing energy efficiency. This can aid in the achievement of municipal waste circularity and recycling targets.;

column1: GHG Reduction - Transports;TA1.10;Waste Reduction - Plastic & Packaging;-1;The reduction of GHG emissions in the transport sector can lead to increased use of alternative fuels and packaging materials
column2: potentially resulting in more plastic and packaging waste
column3: which can constrain waste reduction efforts in this area. This can create a trade-off between transport-related GHG reduction and plastic and packaging waste reduction goals.
